name: Navy Grog
instructions:
1. Put all the ingredients in a blender. Flash-blend for 3 to 5 seconds. Pour into a glass. Serve with an ice cone around straw.
2. Ice Cone“This was the signature Navy Grog garnish throughout Tiki’s midcentury golden age. Prep the cone in advance with a Beachbum Berry Navy Grog Ice Cone Kit. (Or you can just pack a pilsner glass with finely shaved ice, run a chopstick through the middle to make a hole for the straw, then remove the cone from the glass and freeze the cone overnight. I won’t take it personally. Well, maybe just a little bit.)”—Jeff “Beachbum” Berry
description: In the March/April 2024 issue, Jeff "Beachbum" Berry shares the cocktail that "upended and uprooted [his life], giving it an unexpected—but entirely welcome—second act": the Navy Grog. While his recipe for his New Orleans bar Latitude 29 is top secret, he shared a "general public" version for home bartenders to shake up.

ingredients.name: Brown Rum
ingredients.description:
Gold rum, also referred to as amber or golden rum, is a type of rum that falls between light and dark rum in terms of color and flavor. It is a versatile and widely used category of rum with characteristics that make it suitable for various cocktails and sipping neat.

While not aged as long as dark rum, gold rum often undergoes some degree of aging in barrels. The aging contributes to the development of color, flavor, and a smoother texture.

ingredients.name: Jamaican Rum
ingredients.description:
Jamaican rum refers to rum produced in Jamaica, a Caribbean island known for its rich history of rum production. Jamaican rum is renowned for its bold and distinctive flavor profile, often characterized by robust and complex notes.

Jamaican rum has a strong cultural and historical significance, and the island is home to several well-known distilleries, each with its unique approach to rum production. Brands such as Appleton Estate and Wray & Nephew are examples of Jamaican rums that have gained international acclaim.

ingredients.name: Demerara Rum
ingredients.description:
Demerara rum is a type of dark rum produced on the banks of the Demerara River in Guyana, a country on the northern coast of South America. All Demerara rum is distilled in Guyana, regardless of where it may be aged and bottled. There is only one remaining active distiller in Guyana, Demerara Distillers Limited (DDL).

Despite sharing the name, demerara rum is not necessarily made with demerara sugar.

While the vast majority of rum sold today is produced using molasses, Demerara rum is produced using sugarcane juice or “backend,” as it is sometimes called. This gives the rum a flavor profile that is more fruity and grassy than molasses-based rums.

ingredients.name: Honey Syrup
ingredients.description: Syrup made from dissolving honey in water.

ingredients.name: Allspice dram
ingredients.description:
Allspice dram, also known as pimento dram, is a liqueur made from the dried berries of the allspice tree (Pimenta dioica). Despite its name, allspice is a single spice, not a blend. The berries have flavors reminiscent of a combination of cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg, hence the name "allspice."

To make allspice dram, the dried allspice berries are crushed or ground and then steeped in high-proof alcohol to extract their flavors. This infusion is typically sweetened with sugar, resulting in a sweet and spiced liqueur. The final product often has a warm and aromatic profile, with notes of cinnamon, clove, and nutmeg.

Allspice dram is used as a flavoring agent in cocktails, adding depth and complexity to drinks. It's a common ingredient in classic and modern tiki cocktails, where its spice-forward profile complements tropical fruit flavors.

ingredients.name: Crushed ice
ingredients.description: Crushed ice is finely broken ice that melts quickly, making it ideal for cocktails like Mint Juleps and tiki drinks, as it dilutes the drink faster. It has a snow-like texture and is often used to enhance the presentation and taste of beverages.
